message.content:
1st Experiment: 2 Test Tubes
  2nd & 3rd Experiments: Same Number of Test Tubes Each

To solve this problem, we can first find out how many test tubes are needed for the other two experiments together. Since they require the same number of test tubes each, you can simply divide the total number of test tubes (8) by the number of different experiments (3) to find out how many test tubes are needed for each of these experiments.

Total Test Tubes / Number of Different Experiments = Test Tubes per Experiment
8 / 2 = 4 Test Tubes per Experiment

So, for the other two experiments, Sara needed 4 test tubes each.
